sentences.en: Andariel must be made to pay for her sacrilege!
sentences.cn: 安达利尔必须为她的罪行付出代价!

sentences.en: By doing so, she would risk committing a sacrilege.
sentences.cn: 这样一来她就会冒亵渎神明的危险.

sentences.en: Everything you have ever known Kratos, will now suffer because of your sacrilege.
sentences.cn: 你要知道你现在所遭受的一切是来自于你的亵渎.

sentences.en: He regarded the suggestion that he should act such an undignified part a kind of sacrilege.
sentences.cn: 他认为要他扮演这个丢脸的角色实在是对他莫大的侮辱.

sentences.en: Inaccurate representation of the holy is the greatest sacrilege against the holy.
sentences.cn: 对神圣的不正确表达是对神圣的最大亵渎.

sentences.en: It is ( a ) sacrilege to steal a crucifix from an altar.
sentences.cn: 从圣坛窃取耶稣受难像是亵渎神灵的行为.

sentences.en: It is a sacrilege to offend democracy.
sentences.cn: 这是一种对民主的亵渎。

sentences.en: It would be sacrilege to alter the composer's original markings.
sentences.cn: 改动作曲家原有的符号是亵渎行为。

sentences.en: Morgan had committed a kind of sacrilege in dissolving all these hallowed dogmas into thin air.
sentences.cn: 这样,把所有这些神圣教条打得粉碎的摩尔根,就是犯了某种渎圣罪.

sentences.en: Putting water in brandy is ( a great ) sacrilege.
sentences.cn: 在白兰地中掺水是 ( 极 ) 可恶的事.

sentences.en: Putting water in brandy is sacrilege.
sentences.cn: 在白兰地中掺水是可恶的事.

sentences.en: She regarded the damage done to the painting as sacrilege.
sentences.cn: 她认为毁坏了那幅画是大逆不道的事.

sentences.en: Stealing from a place of worship was regarded as sacrilege.
sentences.cn: 从礼拜场所偷东西是对神灵的亵渎。

words.tran_cn: 该受天谴的，亵渎神明的

trans.tran_en: Sacrilege is behaviour that shows great disrespect for a holy place or object
